title: Prepare a Raspberry Pi docker image with Nethermind Goerli
body:
We would like to be able to ship a Docker container for Raspberry Pi so users can launch it with Nethermind Clique-based (e.g. Goerli) for private networks

Best place to seek help from the team is Gitter:
https://gitter.im/nethermindeth/nethermind

This will require you to compile RocksDb and secp256k1 libraries as well as use .NET Core deployment for Raspberry Pi (we have already tested .NET Core deployment - it worked but was complaining about the RocksDb libs that we used which were not compiled for the valid architecture).

For 64bit architecture it will require working with .NET Core 3.0 preview (release planned for May 7th, 2019) https://gist.github.com/richlander/467813274cea8abc624553ee72b28213
https://wiki.ubuntu.com/ARM/RaspberryPi#arm64

It will require Raspberry Pi 3 with ARMv8

A pull request will be accepted if there is a Dockerfile that can be used by the team to build an image that will be then deployed on Nethermind Docker Hub. It should launch with Goerli testnet by default and start synchronizing on launch (this is current standard behaviour with mainnet).

Simple documentation of how to launch the project from Docker Hub and how to configure simple private network of your own should be added to:
https://nethermind.readthedocs.io

i have a closer look if there is any chance-
will update you via gitter with progression info ;-)
Hey @roninkaizen are you still looking into this? We'll be putting a bounty up on it shortly :)

Issue Status: 1. **Open** 2. Started 3. Submitted 4. Done
__This issue now has a funding of 700.0 DAI (700.0 USD @ $1.0/DAI) attached to it as part of the Ethereum Foundation fund.__ * If you would like to work on this issue you can 'start work' [on the Gitcoin Issue Details page](https://gitcoin.co/issue/NethermindEth/nethermind/334/2154). * Want to chip in? Add your own contribution [here](https://gitcoin.co/issue/NethermindEth/nethermind/334/2154). * Questions? Checkout Gitcoin Help or the Gitcoin Slack * $42,113.06 more funded OSS Work available on the [Gitcoin Issue Explorer](https://gitcoin.co/explorer)

Issue Status: 1. Open 2. Started 3. Submitted 4. **Done** 

<hr>

__Work has been started__.


These users each claimed they can complete the work by 10¬†months, 2¬†weeks from now.
Please review their action plans below:


**1) [rlanga](https://gitcoin.co/profile/rlanga) has applied to start work _(Funders only: [approve worker](https://gitcoin.co/issue/NethermindEth/nethermind/334/2154?mutate_worker_action=approve&worker=rlanga) | [reject worker](https://gitcoin.co/issue/NethermindEth/nethermind/334/2154?mutate_worker_action=reject&worker=rlanga))_.**

Action plan:- 
- look into how to re-compile relevant libs to the Raspberry Pi compatible Architecture. 
- run Nethermind client natively on Raspberry Pi and test that recompiled libs run normally
- create Dockerfile to containerise the program with ARM version of the libs and starts up nethermind.runner with goerli config.

Learn more [on the Gitcoin Issue Details page](https://gitcoin.co/issue/NethermindEth/nethermind/334/2154).


**2) [dylanjw](https://gitcoin.co/profile/dylanjw) has applied to start work _(Funders only: [approve worker](https://gitcoin.co/issue/NethermindEth/nethermind/334/2154?mutate_worker_action=approve&worker=dylanjw) | [reject worker](https://gitcoin.co/issue/NethermindEth/nethermind/334/2154?mutate_worker_action=reject&worker=dylanjw))_.**

Ive been looking for a way to put my raspberrypi 3 to use!

Learn more [on the Gitcoin Issue Details page](https://gitcoin.co/issue/NethermindEth/nethermind/334/2154).


**3) [lazaridis-com](https://gitcoin.co/profile/lazaridis-com) has been approved to start work.**

its nearly done.
more chars.....

Learn more [on the Gitcoin Issue Details page](https://gitcoin.co/issue/NethermindEth/nethermind/334/2154).

@ceresstation @tkstanczak its mentioned a Pi with ARMv8 is needed. Does that mean you guys want the Dockerfile based on aarch64 image, or you want it to run an arm32v7 image but prove it works on a pi with armv8?
Hey @tkstanczak any thoughts on the above? @Ryan-Gordon you've been approved :)

Hi @Ryan-Gordon, sorry for the late response - I missed updates on this issue. We expect it to run on 64 bit as for 32 bit there may be trouble with RocksDB.

Hey @tkstanczak thats perfect, thanks for getting back to me. 

Still working on this issue. I will try to provide updates every few days. üëç
